definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to be the right person for the job (idiom)

sentences.english: Thy beauty and thy years full well befits.
sentences.chinese: 你的美貌與年齡總相宜。

sentences.english: The total affordable heavy makeup, dress, high heels, elegant, beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 濃妝淡抹總相宜，連衣裙，高跟鞋，優雅，明媚。

sentences.english: Permanently installed pipework should be appropriately identified.
sentences.chinese: 永久性安裝的管道應當有相宜的標識。

sentences.english: It seemed the peculiarly appropriate attitude for the business I was in.
sentences.chinese: 這似乎是對於我所幹的那樁事情特別相宜的態度。

sentences.english: Shades affordable woman, must have the cloud in the blue sky of water in the bottle of wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 濃淡相宜的女人，要有云在青天水在瓶的智慧。

sentences.english: What you said on the occasion was not appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 在這種場合你說這樣的話是不相宜的。

sentences.english: Review the plan should be combined with the length, rough fitting.
sentences.chinese: 複習計劃要長短結合，粗略相宜。

sentences.english: No matter the thick ink or soft pastels, they both are suitable.
sentences.chinese: 濃墨也好，淡彩也罷，終是相宜。

sentences.english: The Autumnal Equinox is the best time for wheat-sowing.
A long-handled multipurpose stainless pot is suitable for both frying and boiling.
sentences.chinese: 多用不鏽鋼長柄鍋，煎煮兩相宜。

sentences.english: Only in this way, supply and require can be met.
sentences.chinese: 所以兩種教育應該緊緊相聯，這樣才能達到供需相宜。

sentences.english: This was two people down very affordable.
sentences.chinese: 這樣着兩個人倒也很相宜。

sentences.english: Col. 3:18 Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 西三18作妻子的，要服從丈夫，這在主裏是相宜的。

sentences.english: Includes cassettes, answer keys, and course instructions that are suitable for self-study and tutorial.
sentences.chinese: 學生課本隨附課程指導，教學與自修兩相宜。

sentences.english: It is an unseemly blot on the skirts of your empire.
sentences.chinese: 這是你帝國邊境上的一個不相宜的污點。

sentences.english: Combine work and relaxation in complete serenity.
sentences.chinese: 寧靜的環境，工作休閒兩相宜。

definition: shade (of a color, i.e. light or dark)
timely/at the right moment/appropriate to the occasion/opportune/to fit current fashion
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
each in the correct place/each is provided for
